properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts at transportnsw.info for the latest info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Walk with Christ - road closures and clearways
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Walk with Christ - road closures and clearways.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Walk with Christ - road closures and clearways
arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 273225_1684196558410_Walk with Christ - road closures and clearways.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and clearways will be in effect for the Walk with Christ Religious Procession in the Sydney CBD between 2.30pm and 4.30pm from Martin Place to St Marys Cathedral.

Traffic will be heavy in the city while roads are closed. Motorists should avoid unnecessary travel through the city where possible or allow plenty of extra travel time.

Road closures:

  • From 2:30pm to 4:30pm sections of Pitt, O'Connell, Bligh, Spring, Castlereagh, Phillip, King, Elizabeth, George and Hunter Streets will close.
  • From 2:50pm to 4:30pm sections of College St, Macquarie St, Prince Albert Rd and St James Rd will close.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 1pm until 4pm on sections of College, Hunter, Macquarie and Pitt Streets. Clearways are strict no-parking zones and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit Holders. Check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 2.30PM TO 4.30PM

  • Bligh Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place
  • Castlereagh Street between Hunter Street and King Street
  • Elizabeth Street between Market Street and King Street (northbound only)   
  • Elizabeth Street between King Street and Hunter Street
  • George Street between Margaret Street and Hunter Street (southbound only)
  • Hunter Street between George Street and Pitt Street (eastbound only)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street
  • King Street between Phillip Street and Elizabeth Street
  • O Connell Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street    
  • Phillip Street between Bent Street and Hunter Street 
  • Phillip Street between Hunter Street and King Street    
  • Spring Street between Gresham Street and Pitt Street

FROM 2.50PM TO 4.30PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and Park Street   
  • Macquarie Street between Bent Street and St James Road   
  • Prince Albert Road between Macquarie Street and St Maryâ€™s Road
  • St James Road between Elizabeth Street and Macquarie Street

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones that apply to all vehicle types, and to local residents, businesses or Transport for New South Wales Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location. 

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 1PM TO 4PM

  • College Street between Prince Albert Road and William Street (eastern side)
  • Hunter Street between Pitt Street and Macquarie Street (both sides)
  • Macquarie Street between St James Road and Hunter Street (western side)
  • Pitt Street between Hunter Street and Martin Place (eastern side)

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Race Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 11am, last race from 4:25pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Rabbitohs v Raiders at Accor Stadium. Kick-off from 7:25pm, full-time around 9:20pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Sea Eagles at McDonald Jones Stadium. NRL kick-off at 4:05pm, full time around 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Konstantinos Argiros at Qudos Bank Arena. Acts start from 7.30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Broncos at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 7:35pm and full time around 9:35pm. 

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Winter Cup Race Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. Gates open 10am, first race at 11am and last race from 4:20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Dragons at BlueBet Stadium. NRL kick-off from 6:15pm and full time approx. 8:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Bulldogs. Kick-off from 2pm, full time around 3:50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the match and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Pregnancy, Babies and Children’s Expo at Sydney Showground. Starts daily at 10am, finishes 3pm Friday and 4pm Saturday and Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park, including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd. Traffic is also expected to be heavy along Underwood Rd, Hill Rd and Australia Ave before and after the event with increased ride share and taxis in the area.

Local roads within Sydney Olympic Park may be closed for the events. See the Sydney Olympic Park road closure map for details. Allow extra time and follow the directions of traffic controllers on site. Roads will re-open after crowds have cleared the precinct. 

Attendees driving should pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before to secure a space.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Public transport will be busy as Vivid Sydney also takes place at Central, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the GABS Craft Beer Festival on Friday 2 June from 6pm to 11:30pm, and on Saturday 3 June from 11am to 11:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the event while visitors also attend Vivid Sydney precincts in Darling Harbour.

Road closures will be in place on Darling Drive between Pier Street and Ultimo Road from 5.30pm to midnight for Vivid Sydney, so allow extra travel time.

The Central Coast Comicon will be held at the Entertainment Grounds in Gosford from 11am to 5pm on Saturday 27 May 2023. There will be a reduced speed limit in place of 40km/hr on Racecourse Road. Please exercise caution as there will be increased pedestrian activity as event goers make their way to and from the event.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Sydney Streets event in Haymarket. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Hay St will be closed in both directions between Sussex St and Harbour St from 9am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Harbour St, Sussex St, Little Hay St, Factory St, Kimber Ln and Little Pier St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Hay St, Harbour St, Sussex St and Little Hay St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee apply

Jo Koy live at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts from 7:30pm.

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

AFL: GWS Giants v Richmond at GIANTS Stadium. First bounce at 1:10pm, finish approx 3pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Allow extra travel time and arrive early as people also travel to an from the precinct for an expo being held at Sydney Showgrounds until 4pm. 

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close some local roads to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, visit Sydney Olympic Park Authority and check out the interactive map.

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time, available until 11:59pm the night before the event.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Raiders at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off from 8pm, full time approx 10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium in the Friday evening peak.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men Grand Final: Melbourne City v Central Coast Mariners at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off from 7:45pm, finish around 9:55pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during the busy evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 10pm to 10:30pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while the road closures are in place at the end of the game. Travel on trains included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Women's State of Origin match at CommBank Stadium. Main game kick-off from 7:45pm, finish around 9:20pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during the busy evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 9:30pm to 10pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Light rail services and buses run frequently to Moore Park so leave the car at home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park Game Day Clearway Map

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Moana Pasifika at Allianz Stadium. Kick-off from 7:35pm and full time around 9:10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game and while Vivid Sydney also takes place.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to the EP3 grass car park (open from 4:30pm) and drop off areas will be maintained from Lang Rd - from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Michael Bublé at Newcastle Entertainment Centre. Doors open at 7pm, show starts at 8pm and finish around 10pm.

Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Newcastle Entertainment Centre including Griffths Rd, Chatham Rd and Broadmeadow Rd as fans travel to and from the concert.

Right hand turns from Griffiths Rd into the venue may be restricted, causing delays for some motorists. Left hand turns into the venue will not be impacted.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, follow signs and directions from Police and traffic controllers on site.

The Coonabarabran Sorry Day March will take place on Friday 26 May. John Street (Newell Highway) will be closed between Gordon Street and King Street from 10:30am to 10:45am. Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.diversions: Motorists travelling north and south through Coonabarabran are advised to detour around the closure via Edwards Street, Namoi Street and Saleyards Road.

properties.publicTransport: Ticketholders are encouraged to catch public transport as parking at the Zoo and in surrounding streets is very limited. Ferries and buses run regularly to Taronga Zoo from the city and north shore. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney's iconic Tarong Zoo will light up during Vivid Sydney for two ticketed sessions at 5.30pm and 7.30pm on Wednesday to Sunday nights including public Holiday Monday. Pre-purchased event tickets are required.

Road closures may be in place on Bradleys Head Rd between the Zoo entry and Zoo wharf to manage large crowds and access to car parks. Follow directions of traffic controllers and Zoo staff on site.

Motorists should expect delays on Military Rd, Spit Rd and Bradleys Head Rd as attendees travel to the Zoo ahead of each session.

Commuters are advised to allow additional travel time through Mosman during the evening peak on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday nights during Vivid.

webLinks.linkText: Hunter Valley Caravan, Camping, 4WD, Fish and Boat Show

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport
properties.otherAdvice: Large crowds are expected to attend the 26th Annual Hunter Valley Caravan, Camping, 4WD, Fish & Boat show from Friday 26 to Sunday 28 May, 9am to 5pm daily. A speed restriction of 40km/hr will be in place on Les Darcy Drive (New England Highway) from High Street to Devonshire Street. Traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Maitland Showground including The New England Hwy (Les Darcy Dr), Ken Tubman Dr, Cessnock Rd, Anzac Rd, Louth Park Rd and High St. Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.
properties.displayName: Hunter Valley Caravan, Camping 4WD, Fish and Boat Show

webLinks.linkText: Vivid Sydney & TfNSW Interactive road closure map

properties.publicTransport: On Fridays from 6pm and weekends from 5pm buses and light rail services will not run to Circular Quay. Buses will be relocated to stops at Martin Place and light rail services will run to and from Town Hall only. On Saturday nights and Sunday of the long weekend trains will not drop off passengers at Circular Quay. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your Vivid Sydney experience.
properties.otherAdvice:
Vivid Sydney returns for its 13th year to light up the city for 23 consecutive nights from Friday 26 May to Saturday 17 June from 6pm to 11pm each night. Road closures and special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect each night. 

Nightly - CLOSURES IN PLACE

  • 12pm - midnight: Cumberland St south of Essex St.
  • 3pm - midnight: Circular Quay West at the Overseas Passenger Terminal.
  • Each weekend From 2pm Friday to 1am Monday, George St will close between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for the Rocks markets.

Fridays - CLOSURES IN PLACE

  • 5pm – midnight: closures in The Rocks and Walsh Bay including George St north of Alfred St, Hickson Rd to Pottinger St, Windmill St, Argyle Place, Pottinger St, Dalgety Rd and surrounding local streets.
  • 6pm – midnight: roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Pitt, Young, Phillip and Loftus Streets, and Darling Dr between Pier St and Ultimo Rd.
  • 7pm – midnight: northbound lanes of George St from Grosvenor St to Essex St and Essex St westbound.

Managed access to some hotels and businesses around The Rocks and Circular Quay will be maintained by traffic controllers on-site throughout Vivid Sydney when safe to do so.

The cycleway on Pitt St between Underwood St and Bridge St will closed each Saturday night and Sunday 11 June from 5pm to midnight.

Special event clearway parking restrictions are in effect from 3pm to midnight each night on various key roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, with more widespread clearways in the Sydney CBD in effect on weekends.

From 7am Friday 12 May to 1am Saturday 24 June clearways are in effect on Hickson Rd from opposite Pier One Hotel to the end of the parking bay (southbound, all parking spaces). From 9pm Wed 24 May to 1am Sun 18 June clearways are in effect on Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (Eastbound).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.


Millers Point, Dawes Point

From 7am Friday 12 May to 1am Saturday 24 June

  • Hickson Road from accessibility parking opposite Pier One Hotel to end of the parking bay before joining Hickson Road Southbound, all parking spaces

From 9pm Wed 24 May to 1am Sun 18 June

  • Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St Eastbound, kerb side only

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road, Bridge St, Grosvenor Street
roads.suburb: Sydney CBD, Circular Quay, The Rocks, Walsh Bay, Barangaroo, Darling Harbour

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while the road closures are in place at the end of the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: CommBank Stadium event road closures and bus changes map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: CommBank Stadium event road closures and bus changes map.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: CommBank Stadium event road closures and bus changes map
arrangementAttachments.uniqueFileName: 915537_1681868211483_CommBank Stadium event road closures and bus changes map.pdf

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Cowboys at CommBank Stadium. NRL kick-off from 8pm, finish around 9:45pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during the busy evening peak. Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd. Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 9:30pm to 10pm to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Sydney Swans v Carlton at SCG. AFL first bounce from 7:50pm and full time around 10:30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as thousands of fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd. Traffic may also be heavier through the city while closures are in place for the first night of Vivid Sydney.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
